sentence.Network_en: Without some drastic and immediate cutback in expenses, It'simply wasn't possible.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果不立即大幅度地削减开支, 这根本是不可能的.

sentence.Network_en: People are concerned about the cutback in federal welfare programs.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们关注著联邦福利计划的削减.

sentence.Network_en: However, even after the cutback in their leverage , the Turtles kept performing.
sentence.Network_cn: 然而, 把杠杆降低之后, 还是可以赚钱的.

entry.def: A cutback is a reduction that is made in something.

example.ex: London Underground said it may have to axe 500 signalling jobs because of government cutbacks in its investment.
example.tran: 伦敦地铁称由于政府削减了投资，可能将不得不削减500个信号员的岗位。

means.word_mean: 1. a reduction in quantity or rate

auth_sentence.content: It was not immediately clear how large the cutback will be.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was not immediately clear how large the cutback will be.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was not immediately clear how large the cutback will be.

auth_sentence.content: One former First Sea Lord accused the Government of a "destructive" cutback.
auth_sentence.res_content: One former First Sea Lord accused the Government of a "destructive" cutback.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One former First Sea Lord accused the Government of a "destructive" cutback.

auth_sentence.content: Such studies can be useful when applied in discussions of choices to be made in cutback to school programs.
auth_sentence.res_content: Such studies can be useful when applied in discussions of choices to be made in cutback to school programs.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Such studies can be useful when applied in discussions of choices to be made in cutback to school programs.

sentences.en: The cutbacks are justifiable on the grounds of cost.
sentences.cn: 削减符合成本方面的考虑。

sentences.en: The hospital is freezing staff appointments as part of its cutbacks.
sentences.cn: 这家医院冻结员工职位作为削减开支的一部分。

sentences.en: Many theatres are having to make major cutbacks.
sentences.cn: 许多剧院不得不进行大规模的削减。
